name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the author/maintainer person or organization.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address of the author/maintainer person or organization.

name.title: Name
name.description: The license name used for the package.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

url.title: Url
url.description: A URL to the license used for the package.

name.title: Name
name.description: Package name. Make it descriptive and helpful ;)

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

app_version.title: App Version
app_version.description: The version of the application code underlying the manifest

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: A list of keywords to search the package by

maintainers.title: Maintainers
maintainers.description: A list of maintainers for the package

home.title: Home
home.description: The URL of this package's home page

sources.title: Sources
sources.description: A list of URLs to source code for this project

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: A URL to an SVG or PNG image to be used as an icon

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of what this package does

Dependency.title: Dependency
Dependency.description: Configuration to fetch a Recipe or Operator that another Recipe depends on.

name.title: Name
name.description: Workflow name. This name should be unique among all the resources in your resource. Use an alias if this is not the case.

source.title: Source
source.description: URL to a repository where this resource can be found.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

hash.title: Hash
hash.description: The digest hash of the dependency when retrieved from its source. This is locked when the resource dependencies are downloaded.

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: An optional alias to refer to this dependency. Useful if the name is already used somewhere else.

DAGStringInput.title: DAGStringInput
DAGStringInput.description:
A String input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGIntegerInput.title: DAGIntegerInput
DAGIntegerInput.description:
An integer input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#numeric
for more information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGNumberInput.title: DAGNumberInput
DAGNumberInput.description:
A number input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/numeric.html#numeric
for more information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGBooleanInput.title: DAGBooleanInput
DAGBooleanInput.description:
The boolean type matches only two special values: True and False.

Note that values that evaluate to true or false, such as 1 and 0, are not accepted.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/boolean.html for more
information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

HTTP.title: HTTP
HTTP.description:
HTTP Source

A web HTTP to an FTP server or an API for example.

url.title: Url
url.description: For a HTTP endpoint this can be http://climate.onebuilding.org.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

S3.title: S3
S3.description:
S3 Source

An S3 bucket artifact Source.

key.title: Key
key.description: The path inside the bucket to source artifacts from.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: The HTTP endpoint to reach the S3 bucket.

bucket.title: Bucket
bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket on the host server.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

credentials_path.title: Credentials Path
credentials_path.description: Path to the file holding the AccessKey and SecretAccessKey to authenticate to the bucket. Assumes public bucket access if none are specified.

ProjectFolder.title: ProjectFolder
ProjectFolder.description:
Project Folder Source

This is the path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. In the context
of a desktop run Workflow this folder will correspond to a local folder. In the
context of a workflow run on Pollination this folder will correspond to a Project
scoped folder.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

path.title: Path
path.description: The path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. For a local filesystem this can be "C:\Users\me\simulations\test".

DAGFolderInput.title: DAGFolderInput
DAGFolderInput.description:
A folder input.

Folder is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a folder will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
    }

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGFileInput.title: DAGFileInput
DAGFileInput.description:
A file input.

File is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a file will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for file. The check for extension is case-insensitive.

DAGPathInput.title: DAGPathInput
DAGPathInput.description:
A file or a folder input.

Use this input only in cases that the input can be either a file or folder. For file
or folder-only inputs see File and Folder.

Path is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a path will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

extensions.title: Extensions
extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for path. The check for extension is case-insensitive. The extension will only be validated for file inputs.

ItemType.title: ItemType
ItemType.description: Type enum for items in a list.

DAGArrayInput.description:

more information.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

DAGObjectInput.title: DAGObjectInput
DAGObjectInput.description:
A JSON object input.

JSON objects are similar to Python dictionaries.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html for
more information.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

default.title: Default
default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.

spec.title: Spec
spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.

TaskArgument.description: Task argument for receiving inputs that are not files or folders.

name.description: Argument name. The name must match one of the input names from Task's template which can be a function or DAG.

from.title: From
from.description: A reference to a DAG input, a DAG output or another task output. You can also use the ValueReference type to hard-code an input value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

variable.title: Variable
variable.description: The name of the DAG input variable

ValueFolderReference.title: ValueFolderReference

path.title: Path
path.description: A fixed value for this reference.

annotations.title: Annotations

TaskPathArgument.title: TaskPathArgument
TaskPathArgument.description: BaseModel with functionality to return the object as a yaml string

name.title: Name
name.description: Argument name. The name must match one of the input names from Task's template which can be a function or DAG.

from.title: From
from.description: A reference to a DAG input, a DAG output or another task output. You can also use the ValueReference type to hard-code an input value.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

sub_path.title: Sub Path
sub_path.description: A sub_path inside the path that is provided in the ``from`` field. Use sub_path to only access part of the Path that is needed instead of copying all the files and folders inside the path.

ValueListReference.title: ValueListReference
ValueListReference.description: A reference to a fixed value.

value.title: Value
value.description: A fixed value for this reference.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

DAGTaskLoop.title: DAGTaskLoop
DAGTaskLoop.description:
Loop configuration for the task.

This will run the template provided multiple times and in parallel relative to an
input or task parameter which should be a list.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

from.title: From
from.description: The task or DAG parameter to loop over (must be iterable).

TaskReturn.title: TaskReturn
TaskReturn.description: A Task return output that exposes the values from a function or a DAG.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

TaskPathReturn.title: TaskPathReturn
TaskPathReturn.description: A Task output that returns a file or a folder output from a function or a DAG.

path.title: Path
path.description: Path to the output artifact relative to where the function command is executed.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

DAGTask.title: DAGTask
DAGTask.description: A single task in a DAG flow.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for this task. It must be unique in a DAG.

template.title: Template
template.description: Template name. A template is a Function or a DAG. This template must be available in the dependencies.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: The input arguments for this task.

needs.title: Needs
needs.description: List of DAG tasks that this task depends on and needs to be executed before this task.

sub_folder.title: Sub Folder
sub_folder.description: A path relative to the current folder context where artifacts should be saved. This is useful when performing a loop or invoking another workflow and wanting to save results in a specific sub_folder.

DAG.title: DAG
DAG.description: A Directed Acyclic Graph containing a list of tasks.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for this dag.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.description: Tasks are a list of DAG steps

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: Outputs of the DAG that can be used by other DAGs.

fail_fast.title: Fail Fast
fail_fast.description: Stop scheduling new steps, as soon as it detects that one of the DAG nodes is failed. Default is True.

flow.title: Flow
flow.description: A list of tasks to create a DAG recipe.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: A list of operators and other recipes this recipe depends on.
